meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: GOOD QUESTION

div.a: Who Leaves Comedy Central To Work For The Government?

div.div: Some join the federal government after law school; others after a stint with a campaign, nonprofit or consulting firm. Audrey Chen came from “South Park.”

li.div: Fantastic summary of the startup culture at the CFPB washingtonpost.com/blogs/e... Great to see government working this way

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Qp46PY&via=Digg&text=Who Leaves Comedy Central To Work For The Government?

div.div: ALEC BALDWIN WAS RIGHT
The ban on electronic devices rests on anecdotes, not on hard evidence—because there isn't any.
APPLE

div.a: New Images Of Apple’s Campus 2 Building Show Amazing Detail

div.div: Apple's mammoth new campus revealed.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Qsf58W&via=Digg&text=New Images Of Apple’s Campus 2 Building Show Amazing Detail

div.div: CASH MONEY

div.a: Cambodia Deports Pirate Bay Founder, Receives $59 Million In Aid

div.div: Correlation is obviously not causation. That said, the suspicious series of events surrounding the arrest of Gottfrid Svartholm, one of the founders of popular torrent site The Pirate Bay, does give room to speculation.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Uup3HD&via=Digg&text=Cambodia Deports Pirate Bay Founder, Receives $59 Million In Aid

div.div: WHO ARE THESE PEOPLE?

div.a: Over One-Third Of U.S. Not Using Facebook Or Twitter

div.div: A Google Consumer Survey has found that a large portion of the U.S. population doesn't use Facebook or Twitter.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PeWuh8&via=Digg&text=Over One-Third Of U.S. Not Using Facebook Or Twitter

div.div: WEATHER

div.a: NYC Cleans Up After Two Tornadoes

div.div: Damaging storms that spawned tornadoes in New York City, darkened tens of thousands of homes in the Washington, D.C., area and flooded New England streets turned a normal day of rest into a day of cleaning up for many East Coast residents on Sunday.
SPEEDING

div.a: Why Texas' Insanely Fast 85 MPH Speed Limit Isn't A Big Deal

div.div: In November, a portion of a Texas highway will open with a speed limit of 85 miles per hour — the fastest in the Western Hemisphere, according to some reports.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QtbauN&via=Digg&text=Why Texas' Insanely Fast 85 MPH Speed Limit Isn't A Big Deal

div.div: SOUNDED BETTER IN HIS HEAD

div.a: Obama Asks Child For Birth Certificate

div.div: During an unscheduled campaign stop at a sports bar, President Obama was informed that one of the patrons, a seven-year-old child, was born in Hawaii. Then the inevitable happened.
NOT FOR THE FILTERS

div.a: Why Facebook Had To Buy Instagram

div.div: A small panel of young users has shed some light on the rationale behind the biggest acquisition of the year.
THE KING'S BIBLE

div.a: How Much Is Elvis' Bible Worth?

div.div: A bible which once belonged to Elvis Presley was just auctioned for a shocking sum.
WHO BUILT THAT PLANE?

div.a: Romney Plane Breaks Down, Restless Press Turns To Twitter

div.div: The Romney plane broke down on Saturday. To cope with their indefinitely late night, reporters drank beer, played an increasingly ironic playlist on someone's iPad (feat. "Leaving on a Jet Plane") — and, of course, got on Twitter.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OxwCdy&via=Digg&text=Romney Plane Breaks Down, Restless Press Turns To Twitter

div.div: A single four-month deployment to Afghanistan is associated with brain changes and diminished attention.
AMAZON

div.a: New Kindle Fire Lacks FCC Approval

div.div: Amazon trumpeted cutting-edge wireless technology as a key selling point for the fanciest of the new Kindle devices introduced on Thursday. There's just one problem: the devices have not yet been approved for sale by the Federal Communications Commission.
READ THIS

div.a: No Rules, Wearable Computing And Valve's Big Picture

div.div: Behold the future of video games, computing, and who knows what else.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tw4Fbi&via=Digg&text=No Rules, Wearable Computing And Valve's Big Picture

div.div: BUILD IT AND HOPE THEY COME

div.a: The Risky Economics Of Sports Stadiums

div.div: The trials of the Phoenix Coyotes, the least popular hockey team in the NHL, offer a lesson in public debt and defeat.
LESS THAN MITT PAYS IN TAXES?

div.a: Larry Flynt Offers $1 Million For Mitt Romney's Tax Returns

div.div: The Hustler magazine founder, editor and publisher announced that he is offering "up to a million dollars in cash" for Romney's "tax returns and/or details of his offshore assets, bank accounts and business partnerships."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TsM0ND&via=Digg&text=Larry Flynt Offers $1 Million For Mitt Romney's Tax Returns

div.div: PHOTOGRAPHY
Two photographers risked their lives to become the first people to capture the explosive moment fiery lava crashes into the sea.
IF THE GLOVE ISN'T LEGIT...

div.a: Ex-Prosecutor Claims O.J. Simpson Attorney Tampered With Glove

div.div: Nearly 17 years after O.J. Simpson walked away from his Los Angeles murder trial a free man, a prosecutor at the center of the case has alleged that the lead defense lawyer tampered with a crucial piece of evidence.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Oh2qY8&via=Digg&text=Ex-Prosecutor Claims O.J. Simpson Attorney Tampered With Glove
